title: Dashboard
text:
This is the dashboard page. It includes an HTML snippet (and loads in custom javascript) in order to provide the dashboard below. While this is a fully functional version of the dashboard, presentation like this (in a frame within a website) might be restrictive and make it more difficult to use, so there is also a provided link to go full-size.
At the moment, both the embedded version and the full screen version are two separate, fully-functional replicated apps to ensure they work nicely in both formats; however as we develop the app this may become tedious and we might instead implement conditional styling that updates depending on whether you are looking at the content full-screen or not.
Alternatively, if the homepage of the webapp is a text-based page that describes the use of the app, we might not have to keep this ‚Äúframing page‚Äù at all, and instead the ‚ÄúDashboard‚Äù link directly launches the full-screen version. We just need to keep in mind that the user needs some context and direction before being thrown in at the deep-end with the tool.

title: Dashboard
text:
Logistical details
At the top of this page, the leaflet css stylesheet is loaded. We can include a note for this in the cookies banner - I‚Äôll check the GDPR guidelines surrounding this; for the moment I have also copied this locally to prevent any issues.

title: Landing page
text:
This is the home page of the website, written in markdown. You might want to embed the dashboard here directly, or just have an information screen if you don‚Äôt want to overwhelm users.
For this example, I‚Äôve kept this page minimal and have added a button below to view the webapp (or you can use the navbar at the top).
Of course, this can be made more colourful and friendly, with the addition of images, illustrations, etc.
